meanings.definition: Retrieve or recover (something previously lost, given, or paid)
meanings.sent1: She reclaimed her lost necklace from the park.
meanings.sent2: The detective reclaimed the stolen painting from the thief.
meanings.sent3: After searching for hours, she finally reclaimed her missing keys.
meanings.sent4: He reclaimed his borrowed book from his forgetful friend.
meanings.sent5: The hiker reclaimed his misplaced map and continued on his journey.

meanings.definition: Bring (waste land or land formerly under water) into or back into cultivation
meanings.sent1: The farmers reclaimed the barren land for farming.
meanings.sent2: The community reclaimed the marshy area and turned it into a beautiful park.
meanings.sent3: With hard work, they reclaimed the dry desert and made it fertile.
meanings.sent4: The gardeners reclaimed the neglected yard and transformed it into a lush garden.
meanings.sent5: They reclaimed the flooded field and planted crops for the season.

meanings.definition: Convert (waste or abandoned land) into productive use
meanings.sent1: The company reclaimed the old factory site for a new office building.
meanings.sent2: The city reclaimed the abandoned lot and built a playground for children.
meanings.sent3: They reclaimed the unused warehouse and turned it into a bustling market.
meanings.sent4: The team reclaimed the vacant field and set up a community garden.
meanings.sent5: She reclaimed the derelict property and renovated it into a cozy home.

meanings.definition: Rescue (someone or something) from a state of decline.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter reclaimed the kitten from the burning building.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers reclaimed the historical building from decay and restored it.
meanings.sent3: They reclaimed the injured bird and nursed it back to health.
meanings.sent4: The organization reclaimed the struggling business and helped it thrive.
meanings.sent5: He reclaimed the dying plant by giving it proper care and sunlight.
